info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 4:04PM EDT until June 27 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids MI
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Michigan, including the following county, Kalamazoo.
* WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT Friday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 403 PM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges indicated an additional 1 to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last few hours. This is in addition to 1 to 2 inches of rain that fell early this morning. An additional 0.5 to 1.0 inches of rain are expected over the next 2 hours. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kalamazoo, Portage, Vicksburg, Galesburg, Parchment, Schoolcraft, Climax, Richland, Comstock Northwest, Westwood, Gull Lake, Augusta, Comstock, Scotts and Oshtemo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING
